results.firPara: Oumar Niasse was told by Ronald Koeman he was not wanted at Everton after one 45-minute appearance in pre-season. The Senegal striker was stripped of his shirt number and ordered to train with the clubs under-23 squad but it is a finer detail that shines a light on how far the 26-year-old has fallen since a dream £13.5m transfer from Lokomotiv Moscow in February.
results.secPara: Im in the dressing-room with the under-23s but I dont have a locker, Niasse says. The other players have where they put their stuff but I dont. I come with my bag and I just have a place I know. I put my bag down, I train and after, I put everything in my car and go home.
results.webTitle: Everton’s Oumar Niasse: ‘It’s really sad. I don’t think I deserve this’

results.firPara: A studious, tactical arm-wrestle ended in a draw tonight at Etihad Stadium. It delivered a point that Australia would have taken at half-time and one that Japan set out to achieve before kick-off.
results.secPara: Japan were excellent in the first half, Australia poor. The Socceroos never got to grips with Japans concession of territory and the Blue Samurai perhaps deserved to be more than a goal up after the break. Goalscorer Haraguchi then turned from hero to villain, conceding a needless penalty early in the second half to restore Australias belief and shift the momentum. Thereafter, both sides probed but the clearest opportunities fell Japans way, though Ryan only had one decent save to make.
results.webTitle: Socceroos 1-1 Japan: World Cup 2018 qualifying – as it happened

results.firPara: An uncharacteristically cautious Japan side came away from Etihad Stadium with a precious point in World Cup qualifying after holding Australia to a 1-1 draw – the Socceroos second draw in a week.
results.secPara: Ange Postecoglous side remain on course to reach the tournament in Russia, but their path may have become that bit less straightforward after dropping points away in Saudi Arabia last week and now at home against their old Asian foes.
results.webTitle: Socceroos held by cagey Japan in World Cup qualifying stalemate

results.firPara: Peru face Chile in a vital derby on Tuesday, and much rests on their world-class No9 – a man who, if he wasnt Peruvian, would be playing for Barcelona
results.secPara: Peru face Chile in a vital derby on Tuesday, and much rests on their world-class No9 – a man who, if he wasnt Peruvian, would be playing for Barcelona
results.webTitle: In praise of Peru's Paolo Guerrero: captain, record-breaker, warrior | Luis Miguel Echegaray

results.firPara: • Midfielder injured hamstring during Hollands defeat to France
results.secPara: • Midfielder injured hamstring during Hollands defeat to France
results.webTitle: Georginio Wijnaldum a major doubt for Liverpool versus Manchester United

results.firPara: It may have been a spur-of-the-moment overreaction and Gerard Piqué would not be the first Spain centre-half to be talked out of retirement after Carles Puyols U-turn in 2010, but if he sticks by his decision to stop playing international football in 2018 can he really be blamed?
results.secPara: The Barcelona player, one of the best defenders to have played for Spain, has long been vilified for taking a strong pro-Catalonian independence view and the poisonous reaction to him cutting the sleeves off his full-length shirt as opposed to wearing a short-sleeved one that bears the countrys flag during the 2-0 win against Albania on Sunday night was the final straw.
results.webTitle: Can Gerard Piqué really be blamed for quitting Spain after the 2018 World Cup?

results.firPara: Todays fluff and nonsense is rushed
results.secPara: Todays fluff and nonsense is rushed
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: PSG to make a move for €222m Neymar?

results.firPara: Darren Fletcher, the Scotland captain, has launched a stout defence of Gordon Strachan by insisting the managers refusal to publicly berate his players has helped to keep morale high. Strachan has come under fierce criticism following the 1-1 draw with Lithuania on Saturday, after which, and for merely the latest time, he was confusingly upbeat.
results.secPara: All of the players have great respect for the manager, Fletcher said. We feel he always bats for us. He always tries to protect his players in the press. The players realise that and are very grateful.
results.webTitle: Darren Fletcher backs Gordon Strachan for shielding Scotland after ‘stumble’

results.firPara: Christian Benteke struck the fastest goal in a competitive international and went on to complete his hat-trick as Belgium defeated Gibraltar 6-0 in a World Cup qualifier.
results.secPara: The Crystal Palace striker stole the ball in the home sides half after two Gibraltar touches following the kick-off and weaved his way through their defence to score from inside the area after only 8.1 sec.
results.webTitle: Belgium’s Christian Benteke scores fastest goal in competitive internationals

results.firPara: • United captain left out of a competitive international for first time
results.secPara: Wayne Rooney has insisted he will not contemplate retiring from international football despite being dropped from a competitive England fixture for the first time in his career and a tacit admission from the Manchester United player that he was experiencing the most difficult period of his professional life.
results.webTitle: Wayne Rooney says he will not quit England despite being dropped
